alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Northern Cayuga; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Rain Showers ending with a Burst of Heavy Snow... While scattered showers are upon the north Central New York region, a fast moving line of initially rain, quickly changing to heavy snow will move across north Central New York this early evening. Visibilities will drop to a half mile or less, and wind gusts will increase to around 40 to 50 mph. Expect poor visibility within heavy snow for around an hour or so, with visibility improving with the departing snow. Roads, wet this early evening may become icy later this evening as temperatures drop well below freezing, and pavement surface cools to allow ice formation. This line of heavier snow will cross the north Central New York region through 7:30 to 8:00 pm. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Visibility will quickly drop in heavy snow. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations.
